scenes.location: STREETS OF BRIGHTON BEACH AND CONEY ISLAND 5

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ma! Ma! C’mon, Ma!

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Harold. Please. Not again the TV. She slams the door closed and Harry talks to the shut doo

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why do you haveta make such a big deal out of this? Eh? You know you’1l have the set back in a couple of hours. No answer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why ya gotta make me feel guilty? (frustrated) Ahhh... Harry walks across the room to the early eighties TV with ridiculous rabbit ears. Sara locks the door and retreats to the back of the close Harry starts to push the set on its stand when suddenly i jerks - almost falling. Harry spies a thick bicycle chain going from around the TV to the radiator.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Jesus! Whatta ya tryin’ to do, eh? You tryin’ to get me to break my own mother’s set? Or break the radiator? Harry marches to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ..an’ maybe blow up the whole house? You tryin’ to make me a killer? Your own son? Your own flesh and blood? WHATTA YA DOIN’ TA ME?

dialogues.speaker: YOUR OWN SON
dialogues.text: Then, a thin key slowly peeks out from under the closet d Harry works it out with his fingernail and yanks it up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why do you always gotta play games with my head for krist’s sake? Don’t you have any considerations for my feelings? Why do you haveta make my life so difficult? And then, meekly from the closet -

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Harold, I wouldn’t. The chain isn’t for you. The robbers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then why didn’t you tell me? The set almost fell. I coulda had a heart attack. Sara shakes her head in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You should be well, Harold. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then why won’t you come out? Harry tries to open the locked closet door but can’t.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: See what I mean? See how you always gotta upset me? Harry walks to the TV, unlocks the chain and starts to wh the TV towards the front door. He pauses by the closet.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ma? Ma? C’mon out? Please, Ma. No response. Inside, Sara hugs her knees. Then, he throws up his hands, mumbles -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Eh, screw it. And pushes the set carefully out of the apartment. In the closet, Sara hears the door shut. She mumbles to herself -

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: It’s not happening. And if it should be happening it would be alright, so don’t worry, Seymour. It’1ll all work out. You’1ll see already. In the end it’s all nice.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK -
dialogues.text: - AND THE TITLE: ’REQUIEM FOR A DREAM’

dialogues.text: EXT. SARA’S APARTMENT - HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS Waiting for Harry is Tyrone C. Love, young twenties, lean against the wall, playing skillfully with a yo-yo. Taking his time, Tyrone helps Harry wheel the set to the dingy elevator.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit, this mutha startin’ to look a little seedy, man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, ya particular all of a sudden?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, ah don’t care if it’s growin’ hair just so’s we get our braid.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 4 EXT. SARA’S BUILDING - BRIGHTON BEACH, BROOKLYN - DAY 4 Lining the front of the building in beach chairs are ten female Yentas absorbing the sun and passing judgement on Harry. Harry says hello and is greeted by a chorus of fake, sarc ‘hellos’ in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Tyrone carefully navigate the TV through the st of the old Brooklyn neighborhood. They go under the elevated train, past the giant, dying projects, across the boardwalk, beneath the shadows of th towering parachute jump and through the cracking and boar up amusement park. THE TITLES END.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN IN WHITE LETTERS: ’SUMMER’

dialogues.text: Old and squat Mr. Rabinowitz shakes his head as Harry and Tyrone push the set into his store. He stands behind a cage of bulletproof glass with all of pawn shop’s possessions.

dialogues.speaker: MR RABINOWITZ
dialogues.text: So look, the table too already. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, what do you want from me? I can’t schlep it on my back.

dialogues.speaker: MR RABINOWITZ
dialogues.text: You got a friend.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Hey man, I ain’t my leper’s schlepper. Harry chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: MR RABINOWITZ
dialogues.text: Such a son. A goniff. Your mother needs you like a moose needs a hat rack. The pawn shop owner clucks his tongue and slowly counts o the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighter flicks-liquid on spoon sizzles-tourniquet snaps- needle sucks-hand slaps vein-a thunderous rush of liquid- finally an ecstatic sigh. INT. TYRONE’S DIVE PAD - LATER Tyrone’s pad is run down but it’ll do. Tight on Harry bac spinning a record on the turntable and halting the beat. Then he lets the other turntable spin and start a new tun

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit, that’s some boss scag, baby. I mean DYN-A-MITE.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, something else. Harry calmly watches the record spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone and Harry sit at the counter of an all-night donut shop, sipping hot chocolate and eating chocolate Crullers

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Ya know what we oughta do, man? Huh? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We oughta get a piece of this Brody shit and cut it and off it, ya dig?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This stuff’s good enough to cut in half and still get you wasted. We could double our money. Easy.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: That’s right. An’ then we buy a couple a pieces an’ we got something’ else goin’, man. It sure would be righteous.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: In no time we’d get a pound of pure straight from Sal the Geep.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: No hassles. That’s all I want, no hassles. Just then, a hulking Cop sits down on the stool next to H Tyrone and Harry both fall silent and slowly sip their ho chocolates. Harry looks down at the Cop’s gun. It’s maybe six inches from his hand. Slowly, he reaches over and undoes the safety latch on th Cop’s holster. Tyrone’s eyes fill with fear. The Waitress comes over and gives the Cop his office.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Can I get you a - Just then, Harry yanks the gun out of the holster. The Co spins around. Harry retreats - CoP Hey! Hey! Harry smiles as the Cop charges. Tyrone snickers. Then Harry tosses the gun over the Cop’s head. Tyrone catches it. The Cop chases Tyrone. Harry and Tyrone laugh as they toss the gun back and fort just over the frustrated Cop’s head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Cop slips and falls on his ass and we -

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Anything else? Huh? Tyrone butts Harry. Harry looks up at the Waitress who st at him. The towering Cop looks over as well.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Well.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, no. Just the check. The Cop returns to his donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rabinowitz shakes his head as Sara enters. He pulls ou a ledger book that is labeled ’Sara Goldfarb’s Tv’.

dialogues.speaker: MR RABINOWITZ
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mrs Goldfarb.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr Rabinowitz, though I’m not so sure how good it is. And you?

dialogues.speaker: MR RABINOWITZ
dialogues.text: Uh, so what can I say? Are you wanting your TV?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Yes, if you don’t mind. Sara pulls a crinkled ten dollar bill out of the corner o her blouse and hands it to Mr Rabinowitz.

dialogues.speaker: MR RABINOWITZ
dialogues.text: Mrs Goldfarb, can I ask you a question, you won’t be taking it personal? Sara shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: MR RABINOWITZ
dialogues.text: How many years we know each other? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR RABINOWITZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (he nods his head) Who’s to count? Why don’t you tell already the police so maybe they could talk to Harry and he wouldn’t be stealing no more the TV.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Oooo, Mr Rabinowitz, I couldn’t, Harold’s my only child. He’s all I have.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S LIVING ROOM - LATER 12 Sara chains the TV to the radiator again. She turns on th set, adjusts the rabbit ears and watches whatever is on. Sara smiles as she settles into her chair. She cermonious removes the plastic wrapper from around a box of chocolat Immediately, she pulls out a chocolate, covered cream and lets it dissolve in her mouth. Her eyes shut in gentle ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking straight up at the thirty-storey building with sh eyes is Marion. She is beautiful, fresh, and in her young twenties. Harry, with a stack of newspapers under his arm, comes up from behind and kisses her on the neck.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SEACOAST TOWER’S FOYER Harry randomly presses one of countless buzzers. An Old Lady responds a moment later.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: Hello? Who is it? Harry mumbles into the speaker. He and Marion try to hold their laughter.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: Who? Harry mumbles again. When the buzzer rings we’re on -  14 15 16 17

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR 14
dialogues.text: - in black-and-white video. A security camera watches Har and Marion jump around as they head to the -

dialogues.speaker: TOP FLOOR 15
dialogues.text: PING! Harry dips his head out the open doors. All clear. He grabs Marion and they dash to the -

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL 16
dialogues.text: - where red, bold warnings on the emergency exit roof doo threaten alarm if the door is opened.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: What do we do now? Harry pulls out a wire from his back pocket and shorts th alarm. Then, he kicks the roof door open. White light rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S LIVING ROOM 17 Her phone rrrings and Sara leans towards it but she conti to adjust the rabbit ears on her set, torn between the pr of the two activities. Finally, four rings later, she lunges for the phone and f down in her viewing chair. She is greeted by a Cheery Voi

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CHEERY VOICE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Mrs Goldfarb? Mrs Sara Goldfarb?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: It’s me. Speaking. The voice is so enthusiastic that she looks over to the T to see if it’s coming from there.

dialogues.speaker: CHEERY VOICE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Mrs Goldfarb, this is Lyle Russel from Malin & Block.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I’m not interested in - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHEERY VOICE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Wait, Mrs Goldfarb. I’m not selling anything. Nothing. I just want to offer you a chance to be on television.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Television?

dialogues.speaker: CHEERY VOICE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) That’s right, Mrs Goldfarb.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t have any -

dialogues.speaker: CHEERY VOICE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) I’m not looking for money, Mrs Goldfarb. I’m calling to tell you you’ve already won. Your name was selected from a long list of available contestants. You’ve been chosen and you now have an opportunity to be on television.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Me? On television? Sara’s eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: LYLE RUSSEL
dialogues.text: (off-screen) That’s right, Mrs Goldfarb. You on television.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I never thought I’d be on television. I’m just a -

dialogues.speaker: LYLE RUSSEL
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Malin & Block discovers contestants for most of America’s favorite television shows.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Qoooooo... Me... me... on... oh T can’t...

dialogues.speaker: LYLE RUSSEL
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Yes, Mrs Goldfarb, you. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LYLE RUSSEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Congratulations! I can’t tell you why you are so lucky, but you are. Congratulations! Sara falls against the back of the viewing chair, one han clutches desperately at the phone, the other on top of he dress. Her eyes bulge, her mouth hangs open.

dialogues.speaker: LYLE RUSSEL
dialogues.text: (off-screen) You will receive all necessary information in the mail, Mrs Goldfarb. Goodbye and... God bless. Click! Sara tries to catch her breath. She awakens from her ecstasy when the phone beeps its off-the-hook sound. INT. SARA’S BEDROOM - A BIT LATER 18 Sara picks up a framed photo. The picture was taken on Harry’s high school graduation day years ago. Harry, in t middle, is an eighteen-year-old in cap and gown. Sara’s husband Seymour hovers over Harry’s left shoulder. On Harry’s right is a younger-looking Sara. She is thirty pounds lighter, has brilliant red hair and wears a red dr and gold shoes. Sara stares at her outfit. Then she rushes to the closet. As she hums a tuneless monotone, she carefully pulls out the last dress on the h She ceremoniously removes the dry-cleaning plastic and sm at her red dress. She puts it on. In the mirror she looks over one shoulder and then the other. She tries to zip up the back, but aft half an inch and many minutes of exertion she gives up. On her hands and knees, she searches through mounds of sh for the special pair. She pulls out the gold shoes and du them off. Shakily, Sara puts them on. She smiles at herse in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Marion throw paper airplanes down on the dying amusement park.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: but why you so hard on your folks? I mean, they give you the bread for rent, money for the shrink - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: They bug me. They’re fucking hypocrites. Harry shrugs - no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Like they’re in that big house with all their cars and money. They pay me off so they don’t have to deal with me. They pay off charities to deal with their racism. Then we’1l see how liberal they are when I come home with a black guy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You know what you gotta do.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You gotta get away from them.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What about your clothes? Maybe you could sell them. Open a store.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: When will I have time to hang with you? A deserved kiss.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ADA’S APARTMENT - HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS 20 barely wearing her red dress, knocks on a door. Ada, an orange-haired woman Sara’s age, answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: So where’s the party? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Party, schmarty. This is like all the parties. When I tell you, you’1l jump out the window.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: A basement window, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S BEDROOM 21 Ada tries to stuff Sara into her red dress but it ain’t happening.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Well, I have a great diet book.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Zophtic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion grabs Harry’s short-circuit wire. Harry, who’s alr inside, looks at his girl’s mischievous eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Marion! Harry gets it. He smiles. Then, Marion yanks the wire.

dialogues.speaker: ALARMS SCREAM
dialogues.text: Harry and Marion bolt to the -

dialogues.speaker: TOP FLOOR 23
dialogues.text: - where both elevators charge the top floor.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: They’re coming. Harry grabs Marion’s hand and pulls her down the hallway. Dead end. Harry and Marion squeeze against the doorway -- fighting urge to crack-up. Then: PING! -- the elevator. A Security Guard charges out. Harry and Marion hold their breath. The Guard heads strai for the staircase. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then our criminals charge --

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR 24
dialogues.text: -- and in black-and-white video make out all the way down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Marion burst out of the front door laughing, al ringing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S MAILBOX - DAY 26 The mailbox opens and Sara disappointedly peers into the empty darkness.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 27 Sara sits in her viewing chair watching television and re her diet book as she slides herself a chocolate. The diet book is called ’Ten Pounds in Ten Days.’ She flips through about a hundred pages of introduction u she comes to the words, ‘FIRST WEEK.’ She stares at the page and suddenly she becomes concerned She reaches for a chocolate-covered caramel as we read th page with her:

dialogues.speaker: BREAKFAST
dialogues.text: 1 hard-boiled egg 1/2 grapefruit 1 cup black coffee (no sugar)

dialogues.speaker: LUNCH
dialogues.text: 1 hard-boiled egg 1/2 grapefruit 1/2 cup lettuce (no dressing) Cup Black coffee (no sugar)

dialogues.speaker: DINNER
dialogues.text: 1 hard-boiled egg 1/2 grapefruit 1 cup black coffee (no sugar) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NOTE: Drink at least 2 quarts of water each day. Sara stares and chews Her eyes focus on the words, ‘no’ ‘ and ‘1/2’. They focus on the repetition of meals. They focus on the insanity, searching for the real information between the lines. She hears a giggle and turns to look at the refrigerator. The fridge tremors slightly -- a small mechanical rattle. Defeated, she drops the book and reaches for another chocolate. Her head starts to hang and tears begin to wel up in her eyes. But then she notices something on the television.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Now, let’s meet our next winner. Straight from Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, let’s give juicy welcome to Mrs Sara Goldfarb. There she is! Herself dressed in red, her hair gorgeous red, walking across the screen, so slim, so trim, so sexy Such curves. This is Red Sara. Our Sara’s tears fade as her chin lifts and she begins to smile. She watches Red Sara pose for the television audience. Sh can hear the applause and the wolf whistles. She puts the chocolates away and lifts up the book -- new hope.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT - MIDSUMMER DAY 28 Bright, summer sun shoots through the window and screams across Marion’s living room floor until it slows and fall upon Harry and Marion. They are asleep, fully dressed in each other’s arms. The racing sounds of the outside midday summer traffic dissipate and they are alone in a vacuum of melodious heartbeats and deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 29 30 16. INT. SARA’S APARTMENT - DAY 29 Ada strips Sara’s hair with a smelly home-made peroxide concoction at the sink. They’re positioned so that they c both watch the TV set from the corners of their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Ech, what a smell. That’s the Gawanus Canal?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Just relax, Dolly, you got a long way to go. You’1ll get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Get used to it? I’m almost losing my appetite. They chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: When’s lunch? Bigger laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Sweetie, we’re lucky if we’re finished before supper.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: So long?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: That’s right. With you we’re starting from scratch one.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: And I thought I would catch a little sun today.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: In a box you’1l catch it. You just relax and think how gorgeous you’11 look with your red hair. Today the hair, tomorrow the sun.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S KITCHEN 30 Marion straightens up the kitchen. Harry is spinning some records on his portable turntable. Tyrone plays with his yo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Anybody wanna waste some time? Marion pulls out three pills. Harry and Tyrone each grab one. Ingestion... WIDE SHOT of the kitchen in time lapse. The next three- minute scene is actually a three-hour event as Harry, Mar and Tyrone hang out. We listen to them at normal, if not slightly slowed down, speed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m starving.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too, get me a Snickers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Damn, Ty, don’t you eat anything except Snickers?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Chuckles. Ah digs Chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You sure as hell don’t know anything about eating, man.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What you need is some good noodle soup.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit, Pepsi and Snickers’1l take care of anything.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And maybe some bread.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: I prefer the type that goes in my pocket not my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Exactly. Angel told me about a job -- In the flash of an eye, Harry changes record after record Tyrone rolls a joint and Marion lights some candles.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: A job! Hah!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: What? You lose a bet? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggles) ; ; Damn, this is a righteous chick, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, we got this idea. Tyrone has this connection, Brody, with some dynamite shit. If we can get some cash together we can get a piece, cut it up and make a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Soon we could get a pound of pure and retire.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We’d get off hard knocks and be on easy street. Someone is at the door. Marion answers it and seven frien pile in. Everyone is in time lapse and everyone is partying. We wa and listen to the evening’s festivities until --

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: What’s the catch? Suddenly, the racing kitchen clock stops.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S BATHROOM - DAY 31 Sara stares in the mirror, blinking at her ridiculously o hair. It’s nowhere near red.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: That’s red?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Well, it’s not exactly red but it’s almost, maybe, in the same family.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: The same family? They’re not even distant cousins already.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It’s a red. Not a red red, but a red. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Red? You’re telling me this is a red?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m telling. It’s a red.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Then what’s orange? If this is a red I want to know what’s orange. 19. 31 Ada looks at Sara’s hair, then her reflection, then back Sara’s hair and then back to her reflection. She purses h lips and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Well, it could be a little orange, too.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: A little orange? It’s a little orange like being a little pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (shrugs) So what’s to worry? It’1l be alright.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What’s to worry? Someone may try to juice me.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Relax, relax, Dolly. It just needs a little more dye. It’1l be alright for television.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: All day long, I’m getting my scalp scraped and burned and smelling like dead fish and I look like a basketball.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Relax. You should learn to relax. That’s your trouble, you don’t know how to relax already. I’m telling you it’s alright. Tomorrow we’1l do it again and you’1l look like Lucille Ball. Ada leads Sara away from the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 INT. MARION’S APARTMENT - DAY 32 (Post-sex) + (pre-sleep) = (intimate talk)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You know something? I’ve always thought you are the most beautiful woman I’ve ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Since the first time I met you.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: That’s nice, Harry. That really makes me feel good.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good for your ego, eh?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well, I can’t say that it does it any harm, but that’s not what I mean. It makes me feel good all over, like...well, you know lots of people tell me that and it’s meaningless, completely meaningless.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You mean because you think they’re putting you on?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No, no, nothing like that. I don’t know or care if they are. I guess maybe they really mean it, but from them it just doesn’t mean anything to me. When you say it, I hear it. You know what I mean? I really hear it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Someone like you could really make it alright for me.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’ve been thinking... Harry drifts off. Marion’s interest is sparked. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: What? Harry looks at Marion. A beat. Then he gets the courage. He jumps out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Here. He pulls Marion. She laughs:

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S KITCHEN 33 Harry in a shirt stands over Marion who’s wrapped in a sh They lean A pause. over a folder on the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You remember when I told you about the store. Well, I’ve been thinking about it. I put together some numbers and it’s not impossible. I think you can do it. We should do it. We can do it together.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: How long have you been thinking about this?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not so long. Since we started hanging out. Marion thinks.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: It’s a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: It is. Let’s do it. Let’s open it in the city. How do we start? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, first me and Ty gotta get money for the piece and then --

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I’1l get it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No, I can.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Really? How?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: How do you think? My fucking parents. A laugh. And then they hug and kiss gently. Harry pulls his face back a few inches from Marion’s.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think I’m falling in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Think? TIGHT SHOTS and QUICK CUTS as Harry kisses the tip of Mar nose, then her eyelids, then her cheeks and her soft lips her chin, her neck and lastly her ear lobes. Then he whispers in her ear:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Marion, Marion, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLINDING WHITE
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S MAILBOX - DAY 34 We pull out of the white and into Sara’s mailbox. She pee in -- empty.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S KITCHEN - DAY 35 TIGHT ON kitchen clock ticking normally. ON Sara’s breakfast -- one hard-boiled egg, half a grapef and a mug of black coffee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON the directions in Sara’s diet book. ON Sara -- blinking at her ‘meal’, a sigh. We watch as she tries to enjoy her breakfast. After the food is gone she fills a glass of water. As she sips it, she notices her hand reaching for something -- something more to eat. TIGHT ON the kitchen clock ticking real slow. Her Timex t same. We see her eyes, her lips, her twitching fingers. A quick glimpse at the fridge. She grabs her stomach and says to it:

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Stop already. (then to herself) You’1l1 feel better in the red dress than a cheese danish.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S BATHROOM 36 Marion throws some cold water on her face. She looks at h naked body in the mirror. She feels lifeless, drab and de QUICK CUTS: Tinfoil crinkles, powder sprinkles, lighter flicks, smoke drifts, straw sucks, a pleasure sigh... Once again, Marion looks in the mirror. Now she looks alive and glorious. Rays of golden light en her body in a gentle glow. She cups her hands under her breasts and smiles as she tu and poses, admiring their size and firmness. "Not bad,’ she thinks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S MAILBOX - DAY 37 Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 38 Sara tries to watch TV but the fridge beckons her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON the kitchen clock, slowly, slowly ticking. The fridge shudders. Frustrated, Sara grabs her folding chair and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. SARA’S BUILDING - DAY 39 The outside of the building is lined with the old Yentas sitting in beach chairs catching the sun. A few have reflectors and stare up at the sun. Sara exits her building and lets the sun hit her hair. He friend Rae says something first.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: Ada told us. It’s gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Thank you. We’re making it a little darker tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: So why darker?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: To match my red dress.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: But now it’s looking like Lucille Ball.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: But I’m not. But soon...I’m ona diet.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Yes, she is.

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: Cottage cheese and lettuce?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: What diet you on?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Eggs and grapefruit.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: Oi vay. I was on that once. Lots of luck, Dolly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: It’s not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: How long you been on already?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: All day.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: All day? It’s one o’clock.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: So, I’m thinking thin. Now, old Mrs. Scarlini pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: MRS SCARLINI
dialogues.text: My Rosie lost fifty pounds like that almost.

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: Like that?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: MRS SCARLINI
dialogues.text: Poof.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: You put her in a sweat box?

dialogues.speaker: MRS SCARLINI
dialogues.text: A doctor. He gave her pills. It makes you not want to eat.

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: So what’s so good about that? You mean I’m sitting here not thinking about chopped liver and pastrami on rye?

dialogues.speaker: MRS SCARLINI
dialogues.text: With a slice of onion and mustard.

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: Herring.

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: Herring?

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: Yeah, herring. In sour cream. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: When the sun goes behind the building I’m having a nosh.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t talk like that when someone’s on a diet.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Eh, big deal. I’11 sneak an extra piece of lettuce. I’m thinking thin.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: The mailman... Just then, the Mailman arrives. Sara picks up her chair a follows him into the building. Ada, Rae and the other Yen follow Sara.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Goldfarb. Goldfarb. I know you have something for Goldfarb.

dialogues.speaker: MAILMAN
dialogues.text: Let’s see. Not much around here except at the beginning of the month with the social security checks.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: But I’m expecting something --

dialogues.speaker: MAILMAN
dialogues.text: Here we go. Something for Goldfarb, Sara Goldfarb. He hands her a thick manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 40 The Yentas follow Sara into the apartment. Yenta #2 flips on the TV, someone else starts a pot of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: So let’s see.

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: Open it, open it. Sara carefully opens the envelope. She takes out a questionnaire.

dialogues.speaker: RAE
dialogues.text: So when do you go on? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: They decide after you send this form.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s so exciting. The other women murmur their excitement, too. Ada takes t application from Sara and places it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: OK, OK. You sit, Dolly and just answer the questions. Sara, a bit nervous, sits down. Ada gives her a pencil an leans over her shoulder. The Yentas crowd around.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Name? Easy enough. S-a-r-a G-o-1l-d- f-a-r-b.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You call that a question? That kind I take six at once. The Yentas laugh as Sara carefully prints her name.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Address.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: A breeze. Sara fills out question after question until:

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Date of Birth.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: So now you’re getting personal. OK, I’1l tell you. She fills it in.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Age?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: So now you want me to count for you! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Marital Status?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: (smiles) Wanting, needing. How about if I win Robert Redford? A big laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Sex? A bigger laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Please? The biggest.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: That’s it, Dolly. Sara holds the paper against her chest and says a short prayer. The Yentas respect her silence. Then she carefully folds it and places it in the self- addressed envelope. She seals it and holds the flap down for many seconds. Then she puts it on her chair and sits on it, just to mak sure it’s sealed. Next she tosses her head and shoulders at the refrigerato and says to it:

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Who needs you?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. SARA’S BUILDING - A MOMENT LATER 41 Sara marches out of the building waving the envelope. The Yentas follow their friend. Victorious, they march to the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: I wonder when you’1l hear?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Maybe they’1l send you to Tavern on the Green, that’s where they send all the stars. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I’m eating eggs and grapefruit at Tavern on the Green. The ladies laugh as they follow their hero, their savior, their victor. Suddenly, the envelope begins to glow. It glows a brilliant white. At the mailbox Sara kisses the envelope and drops it in t mail slot. She closes the lid and then opens it to make sure it has dropped into the box. And then the ladies huddle around Sara as _ the blue mail begins to radiate and bathe them in a cool blue light. Th Yentas ‘ooooh’ and ‘ahhh’.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TYRONE’S DIVE PAD 42 Tyrone is on the phone with Brody’s Henchman. Harry sits the table counting twenties into a small, neat pile.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Dynamite? Dynamite. Dynamite! Alright, we’s on the way. Tyrone hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Brody’s man says it’s real fine shit.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Alright. Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (serious) Let’s do this right.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Naturally. Tyrone takes the money and slaps Harry five. Exit Tyrone. Harry spins some vinyl, rolls a joint, sparks it and take few pokes. He starts grooving with the music as his nervousness dissolves. Then something is off and Harry feels it. He stops the turntable. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it’s a sunny day in Tyrone’s bedroom. The back wall is gone and stretching into the sea is --

dialogues.speaker: THE CONEY ISLAND PIER 43
dialogues.text: Now, strolling with a baby carriage is a woman in a red d It’s Marion. Harry watches her from Tyrone’s apartment. He calls for her but she keeps going. He chases after her He’s trying to get a glimpse into the carriage. Finally, Marion hears him and she spins around. She smiles and wav She reaches into the carriage to pick something up. Harry is almost with her. He keeps running. And just as he’s about to get a peek, he stops. He hears key in a lock. He spins round and we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. TYRONE’S DIVE PAD - NOW 44 Tyrone enters the room with a big-ass, shit-eatin’ grin o his face. He drops a little package on the table.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: There it is, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: There it is. Harry snaps out of it and he looks at the package.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Shall we try?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Wait, Ty. This is our chance to make it big and I mean really big. We don’t have to be dealin’ in no petty-ass pieces all our lives. we play it right an’ we can get a pound of pure, but if we get wasted we’11l fuck it up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Right, on, baby, ahm not jivin’ you. Ah doan’ want to be runnin’ no streets the res’ of mah life in no ripped sneakers, mah nose runnin’ down to mah chin. All we gotta do is have a little taste so we know how much to cut it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fair enough. Palms slap, then: flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh... And: flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh... Tyrone and Harry look at each other with flush faces and hanging heads. They grin at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit... Then they laugh and laugh and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion sits in front of the Wonder Wheel watching the sum crowd play. She unpacks the shopping bag next to her. She pulls out some sketch pads, pencils, charcoal and a sharpener. She stares at the blank page. A moment later, she begins sketch.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 46 Sara sits in her chair trying to watch TV. But she can’t concentrate. The kitchen clock ticks terrib slowly. So does her Timex. Everywhere she looks in the room steaming hot food appear Over there, by her plants, is a bacon doublecheese burger Then over there, by the lamp, is a chocolate-covered ecla (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She grabs a glass of water and downs it. She turns to the fridge. It shudders at her. She screams at it:

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Shut up! Suddenly the fridge door becomes transparent. She can see all the produce in her stuffed fridge beckoning her. She turns away and goes into --

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM 47
dialogues.text: She flips off the light and tries to sleep. She closes her eyes but they pop open. Then slowly her be ceiling disappears and turns into a clear blue sky with p white clouds. Then it dissolves into a sizzling, juicy pi pie. Sara twists and turns. Then the pie turns into a chocolat covered cherry. Then it becomes a bagel smothered with lo onions and crowned with a healthy slice of tomato. There’s no hope. Sara sits up in her bed and reaches for the phone. She dials.

dialogues.speaker: MRS SCARLINI
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Louise, it’s Sara. I need the number of that doctor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 48 on Harry looking hollow.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why do you have to see him for krist’s sake? Cut the son of a bitch loose. Marion is dressing herself up in front of the mirror. She looks like a million bucks in a chic black dress. She carefully applies her lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I don’t want him mentioning to my parents that I have stopped therapy. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARION, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re already pissed at me and they’re thinking of cutting me off. Marion turns and touches Harry’s face tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, I am not going to sleep with him. He’s got some issue with womanly blood so I told him I’m on the rag. He’s planning on going home after the concert. Harry tries not to sulk, but his chin dips. Then Marion chuckles but Harry doesn’t respond. Suddenly, she hugs hi and squeals with absolute glee.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Oh Harry, you’re jealous! Harry half-heartedly tries to push her away but Marion do let him.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Come on, sweetheart, put your arms around me, come on, please!? Please!? She lifts his hands and puts them on her shoulders as she snuggles deeper into him. Then she starts kissing him on the ears, eyelids and neck and soon he starts to giggle.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Come on, stop, stop you crazy girl or I’1l bite you on the throat. They laugh as they tickle each other and cover each other kisses.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RAOUL’S CAFE - NIGHT 49 A fancy French pretension -- two plates of frogs’ legs, t glasses of Cinzano with twists, and a stunning Marion wit dumpy Arnold the Shrink.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: I’m disappointed that you are indisposed.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Is Anita out of town or something? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I’m just curious if she’s ‘indisposed’.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Marion. No she’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something personal, Arnold?

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: What is it? Arnold leans in. Then she fucks with him. She tells him he’s got something on his face when he doesn’t. She tortu him until all she can do is laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sodium streetlight pops as Tyrone cold lamps by a beat-up bodega. A black hand slaps Tyrone money. The money slides into hi pocket. Tyrone’s eyes swish left then right. He slips something out from behind the tire of a parked car. And slaps a bag of white powder back. Pop, slap, slide, swish, slip, slap! Again. And again. And again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neon crackle as Harry chills outside an OTB. A white hand slaps Harry money. The money slips into his pocket. Harry’s eyes swish right then left. He clinks something out of a trash can. And he slaps a bag of white powder back. Crackle, slap, slip, swish, clink, slap! Again. And again And again.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 52 53 35. INT. MARION’S APARTMENT - LATER 52 Harry spins Marion around.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We’re on our way, baby, we’re really on our way.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It was great out there. Everyone’s thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I’m so glad. And baby, I’m drawing again. I’m drawing. I can’t stop. Marion takes out her sketchbook. She shows him her sketch Harry and Marion lean into each other, suddenly hugging e other, kissing, dreaming and believing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DOCTOR PILL’S EXAMINING ROOM 53 A Skinny Nurse weight and measures Sara

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY NURSE
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Fine, that’s why I’m here. They both laugh. The Nurse takes Sara’s blood pressure.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY NURSE
dialogues.text: How’s your hearing and vision?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I have both. The Nurse laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY NURSE
dialogues.text: Now, wait just a minute. The nurse smiles and leaves. A moment later, Doctor Pill enters. He looks at the chart the Nurse filled out and then he smiles at Sara. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PILL
dialogues.text: I see you’re a little overweight.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: A little? I have fifty pounds I’m willing to donate.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PILL
dialogues.text: We can take care of that, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: HIP-HOP MINI-MONTAGE 54
dialogues.text: TIGHTS of dope being cut, plastic bags being filled, Tyro and Harry dealing, Marion sketching and sewing, Harry and Marion kissing, Harry spinning tunes, flick, sizzle, snap suck, slap, rush, sigh and crinkle, sprinkle, flick, drif suck, Sigh...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TYRONE’S CLOSET 55 Harry and Tyrone neatly stuff a shoe box full of money. They put a rubber band around the box and hide it in the back of the closet. Harry gives Tyrone five, Tyrone gives Harry five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In photographs, a straight Real Estate Agent shows Harry Marion around the empty store.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE 57
dialogues.text: The Agent snaps a photo of the lovers in front of the sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the table in front of her are four bottles of pills an the instructions.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Purple in the morning. Red in the afternoon. Orange in the evening. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the refrigerator) That’s my three meals, Mr Smarty Pants. (then to herself) Green at night. Just like that. One, two, three, four... She pops a purple: a pill cap pops off, pill hits hand, m gulps, pill cap snaps on. Then she heads to the fridge and makes herself a smoked f and cream cheese sandwich on an onion Kaiser roll. She shows off to the fridge as she devours it. Then she makes a cup of coffee: an empty pot tinkles into place, the coffee perks, the coffee drips, and then Sara slurps, slurps, slurps. She picks up the remote and flips on the set but she can’ seem to sit down, so she heads outside with her chair.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S MAILBOX - DAY 59 She peeks in for anything -- nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion and Harry play skeeball. Marion hits a fifty and smiles. Harry stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s what I’1l1 do.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: For my mom. I’ve been thinking of getting something for her, you know, some kind of present, but I didn’t know what to get.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I finally asked myself, what’s her fix? Television, right? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If ever there’s a TV junkie it’s the old lady. I figure maybe I owe her a new one anyway with all the wear and tear her set got from being schlepped back and forth to old Abe’s.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You really love her, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I guess so. One time I feel one way and the other time I feel something else. Most of the time I just want her to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Let’s go get it now.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: C’mon.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna deal with salesman...

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Oh, come on.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (gets an idea) Well, let’s push off first.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: It’s still early. We shouldn’t get going till tonight.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, but this is different. After all, I was always usin’ the old lady’s set to cop money so now we’ll use a little stuff to get her a set. Marion doesn’t fight him. Then there’s the: flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh... And: crinkle, sprinkle, flick, drift, suck, sigh...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 61 62 63 64 39. INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 61 Coffee: tinkle, perk, drip, slurp, slurp, slurp... and Pi pop, hit, gulp, snap... Sara starts to clean the apartment. Time races by as she intricately cleans every single squa inch of the kitchen. She cleans the inside of the fridge and dumps all the food. Next, she moves into the living room and continues to cle Then everything slows down. Sara collapses into her viewing chair in front of the TV. She tries to watch but she’s squirming in her seat. Then she notices something wrong. She’s not sure what so she heads into --

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM 62
dialogues.text: In the mirror, she stares at her clenched teeth grinding. She wonders what this means. She shrugs and takes the gre pill: pop, hit, gulp, snap...

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE LIVING ROOM 63
dialogues.text: -- Sara sits in front of the TV and watches Tappy Tibbons preach. Slowly she dozes off.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TYRONE’S DIVE PAD 64 Tyrone’s old pad has been spruced up. It’s filled with to of cool toys. It looks like Christmas morning. Beautiful and very young Alice lies naked in the giant be staring at Tyrone. He sits naked at his desk playing with flip books. First there’s a wacky duck dancing, then there’s a crying GI soldier.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Why dontcha come back to bed, honey?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit, plenty time for that, woman, I got me a cool-ass toy ahm groovin’ behind. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tyrone picks up another flip book and lets things rip. Th animation suddenly turns into live action and we are foll the back of a little boy. The boy runs across a black room into the arms of a beaut woman. The boy is Young Tyrone and the woman is Tyrone’s Mother.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TYRONE
dialogues.text: I told ya, Ma. One day I’d make it. TYRONE’S MOTHER You don’t have to make anything. You just gotta love your momma. The image of boy and mother dies when the flip book ends. Tyrone looks at it sadly.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: What are you doing, honey?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Thinking about you, baby, and what I’m gonna do to ya. Tyrone leaps onto the bed and Alice squeals playfully.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Don’t do that, Tyrone. You’1l scare me to death.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Oh little momma, I wouldn’t want to scare you...I doan’ want to scare nobody. All I want from life is no hassles and some peace and harmony...an’ I want it from the finest fox that ever lived.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S MAILBOX - DAY 65 Still empty...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S BUILDING - DAY 66 Pop, hit, gulp, snap and tinkle, perk, drip, slurp, slurp slurp... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Yentas all rise when Sara comes out and they move the chairs so that she can have her proper seat in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: Sara, you know yet when?

dialogues.speaker: YENTA
dialogues.text: Are you hearing anything?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: You can bring friends?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: How should I know?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: They should let you bring at least a schlepper. Who’s going to carry home all those prizes?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Believe me, I’1l get them home. Especially Robert Redford. For him I don’t need a schlepp But Sara is having a hard time sitting still. She looks u and down the street for the Mailman and paces around her friends. They watch her with a bit of concern. Then Mrs Scarlini comes out of the building for sunning. Sara grabs her and hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I love you forever. I can’t believe it but I’m not even thinking of food. If you put down a big bowl of chicken noodle soup I wouldn’t eat it. Thank you so much, Rosie. Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 67 INT. TYRONE’S NEW PAD 67 Alice and Tyrone make some crazy love. Arms flail, teeth bite, mouths scream. Some crazy love.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 68 INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 68 Sara stands in front of the mirror trying on the red dres (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The dress won’t close. Pop, hit, glup, snap... The red dress gets a little closer. Pop, hit, glup, snap... The dress gets even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry squirms in the back seat wearing a sharp new pair o slacks, a sports shirt and a pair of new shoes. He nervously pats down his hair and adjusts his collar.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. SARA’S BUILDING 70 The Yentas all admire Sara’s slim figure until the Mailma approaches. Everyone turns to him--hoping... He grins and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MAILMAN
dialogues.text: When I see it I’1l be waving it all over the place. The Mailman enters the building. A cab pulls up. Harry steps out. He stares at the intimidating line of Yentas. Sara stares for a brief second not computing this apparit Then she jumps up and wraps her arms around him, almost knocking him off balance.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Harry! She kisses him and he kisses her. She’s so excited she ki him again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, take it easy, Ma, you’1l crush me. He gives her a quick smile as he adjusts his clothes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Come, come inside, Harry. I’11 make you a pot of coffee and we’ll have a visit. She grabs his hand and heads to the entrance. INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 43. 70

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 71 Sara makes a pot of coffee as she bustles around grabbing cups, saucers, spoons, milk and napkins. Harry stares wide-eyed at his hyperactive mother. He trie to get a word in but can’t.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: And how are you, Harry, you’re looking so good. You want something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, Ma --

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: A little nosh, maybe, or cake, I’11 go get some if you want, but I don’t have anything in the house but Ada will have something, a cupcake, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No -- Finally, the coffee is ready and she fills two cups.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You want something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (almost screams) No, Ma. Nothing. Sit. Sit, for krist’s sake. You’re making me dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You notice something? You notice I’m slimmer?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I guess you are, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Twenty-five pounds. You believe it? Twenty-five pounds and that’s just the beginning. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s great, Ma. That’s really great, I’m really happy for ya. But sit down, eh? Sara sits, Harry is bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I haven’t been around for awhile, Ma, but I’ve been busy, real busy. Sara nods as she clenches her jaw.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You got yourself a good job? You’re doing well?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, Ma, real good.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What kind of business?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, I’m sort of a distributor, like. For a big importer. My own.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m so happy for you. Sara gets up and smothers Harry with kisses.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, Ma, easy, eh? You’re killing me. Krist, whatta ya been doin’, liftin’ weights?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Your own business. Oh Harry, I knew when I saw you that you had your own business. I always knew that you could do that.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah, Ma, you were right. I made it just like you said I would.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: So now maybe you’1l meet a nice girl and have a baby?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I already met one -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sara squeals and squeaks and starts to jump out of her ch Harry holds his arms up in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Jesus krist, Ma, don’t go ape shit, eh?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Is she a nice girl? who’s her parents? What --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You know’er, Ma. Marion. Marion Silver. Remember, they --

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Oh, Silver. Of course. I know Manhattan Beach. He’s got a house on the esplanade. Garment business.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, he’s big in women’s undies. Harry chuckles. Sara is so happy, she can’t stay sitting. She refills their cups.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Before you go bouncin’ all over again and make me forget, what I want to tell ya is I got you a present and --

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Harry, I don’t want a present, just have a baby.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Later for that, eh? Will you let me tell you what I got, eh? Will ya? Sara nods, grins, grinds and clenches.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Krist, you’re really something else today. Look, I know... well... (deep breath) What I’m trying to say is that...well... (shrugs) Well...I know I ain’t been the best son in the world -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Oh, Harry, you’re a good --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, no! Please, Ma, let me finish. I’1l never get it out if you keep interrupting me. (deep breath) I’m sorry for being such a bastard. (stop -- breathe -- sigh) I wanna make it up. I mean, I know I can’t change anything that’s happened, but I want ya to know that I’m sorry and I love ya, and I wanna make it right.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Harry, it’s --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know why I do those things. I don’t really want to do them. It just sort’ve happens, I guess. I don’t know. It’s all kinda goofy somehow, but I really do love ya, Ma, and I want you to be happy so I got ya a brand new TV set. It’s gonna be delivered in a couple a days. From Macy’s. Sara squeals, but Harry wards her off with his hands. She sits down, grins and grinds her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Oh, Harry, you’re such a good boy. Your father would be so happy to see what you’re doing for your poor, lonely mother. Harry leans over and gives her an honest, open and perfec beautiful kiss.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You see that, Seymour? You see how good your son is? He knows how lonely his mother is living all alone, no one to make her a visit... Harry feels pretty good as he listens to his mother until something puzzles him. He stops hearing his mother and no he suddenly hears some other, strange sound. What is it? He looks around until he looks at his mother. Suddenly he is filled with surprise, disbelief and confusion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The noise he hears is his mother’s teeth grinding. TIGHT ON Sara’s mouth. Harry leans across the table.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, Ma, you droppin’ uppers?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You on uppers? (getting angry) You’re on diet pills, ain’t ya? Sara is suddenly stunned. She’s completely bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: On? On? What is on?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How come ya lost so much weight?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I told you, I’m going to a specialist.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A specialist. What kinda specialist?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What kind? A specialist. For weight.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s what I thought. You’re makin’ a croaker for speed, ain’t ya?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Harry, you alright? (shrugs) I’m just going to a doctor. I don’t know from croaker, making --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What does he give ya, Ma? Eh? Does he give ya pills?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Of course he gives me pills. He’sa doctor. Doctors give pills.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What kind of pills? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What kind. A purple one, red one, orange and --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, no, I mean what kind?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: They’re round...and flat.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (rolls eyes) I mean, like what’s in them?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Harry, I’m Sara Goldfarb, not Albert Einstein. How should I know what’s in them?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, Ma, does that stuff make you feel good sort of and give you lots of pep?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: (nods) Well, I guess maybe a little.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A little? Jesus, I can hear ya grinding ya teeth from here.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: But that goes away at night.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: At night?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: When I take the green one. In thirty minutes I’m asleep. Poof, just like that. Harry shakes his head and rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, Ma, ya gotta cut that stuff loose. It’s no good.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Who said it’s no good? Twenty-five pounds I lost. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Big deal. Do ya wanna be a dope fiend fa krist’s sake?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What’s this dope fiend? Am I foaming at the mouth? He’s a nice doctor.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ma, I’m telling ya this croaker’s no good.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: How come you know so much? How come you know more about medicine than a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (deep sigh) I know, Ma, believe me, I know. You’1l get strung out fa krist’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: C’mon. I almost fit in my red dress, the one I wore at your high school graduation. The one your father liked so much. I remember how he looked at me in the red dress. It’s not long after that he got sick and died and you’re without a father, my poor baby, but thank God he saw you happy for a little and --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s with the red dress? What does that --

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I’m going to wear the red dress on...O0h, you don’t know. I’m going to be on television. I got a call and an application and --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: C’mon, Ma, who’s pullin’ ya leg?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I’m telling you I’m being a contestant on television. They haven’t told me when, but you’1l see, you’1l be proud when you see your mother in her red dress and golden shoes on television. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s the big deal about being on television? Those pills’1l kill ya before ya ever get on, fa krist’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Big deal? You drove up in a cab. You see who had the sun seat? You notice your mother in the special spot getting the sun? You know who everybody talks to? You know who’s somebody now? Who’s no longer just a widow in a little apartment who lives alone? I’m somebody now, Harry. Everyone likes me. Soon millions of people will see me and like me. I’11 tell them about you and your father. I’11 tell them how your father liked the red dress and how good he was to us. Remember? Harry nods. Defeated, he stares at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: And who knows what I might win? A new refrigerator. A Rolls-Royce, maybe. Robert Redford.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Robert Redford?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: So what’s wrong with Robert Redford? Harry blinks and shakes his head. Bewildered, he surrende to her flow. Sara looks at her entire family and a softness overtakes her.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: It’s not the prizes, Harry. It doesn’t make any difference if I win or lose. It’s like a reason to get up in the morning. It’s a reason to lose weight so I can be healthy. It’s a reason to fit in the red dress. It’s a reason to smile, already. It makes tomorrow alright. (close to Harry now) What have I got, Harry? Why should I even make the bed or wash the dishes? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I do them, but why should I? I’m alone. Seymour’s gone, you’re gone, I have no one to take care of. Anybody. Everybody. What do I have? I’m lonely, Harry. I’m old. Harry fidgets, his eyes blink, he tries:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You got friends, Ma. What --

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: It’s not the same. You need someone to make for. No, Harry, I like how I feel this way. I like thinking about the red dress and the television...and your father and you. Now when I get the sun I smile.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’11 come visit, Ma. Now that I’m straight, my business is going good, I’1l1 come. Me and Marion. Honest, Ma. I swear. We’1ll come for dinner. Soon. Sara shakes her head and smiles at Harry, trying hard to believe. Sara gets

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Good, you bring her and I’11 make your soup and a roast.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That sounds great, Ma. I’11 give you a call ahead a time, OK?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: (nods) Good. I’m glad. I’m glad you gota nice girl and a good business. I’m glad. up and hugs Harry, tears welling in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Your father and I were always wanting only the very best for you. I’m glad, Harry, that you have someone to be with. You should be healthy and happy. And have lots of babies. Don’t have only one. It’s no good. Have lots of babies. They’11 make you happy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry does his best to hug his mother. He fights his desperation to get away and holds onto her. Eventually, Sara backs away and looks into his face, smil

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Look, I’m crying already. I’m so happy I’m crying.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (forces smiles) I’m glad you’re happy, Ma. I really love ya. An’ I’m sorry -- Sara waves his apology away -- tosh, tosh.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I really am. But I’m goin’ ta make it up now. You should just be happy.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about me. I’m used to being alone. A long silent beat as child and parent smile at each othe Harry looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I got to go, Ma. I have an appointment in Manhattan in a little bit. But I’1l be back.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Good. I’11 make for you. You still have your key?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (shows her) Yeah, I got it, Ma. I’d better hurry. I’m late now.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Son. One more kiss and hug and Harry is gone. Sara stares at t door for many long moments. Then she takes her orange pill -- pop, hit, glup, snap -- and washes it down with a fresh cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits in the back seat filled with worry and concern Tears well up into his eyes until he can’t hold it any lo He sobs hard, real hard. A moment later he collects himself and gets high: flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh... Harry wipes away his tears.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S BEDROOM 73 Sara zips up the red dress. It closes. She swings around gloriously and her locked jaw smiles at herself in the mirror. Eyes glow. And she begins to waltz by herself. Humming...

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN IN WHITE LETTERS: ‘FALL’

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BRODY’S LIMO 74 Tyrone steps into a white limo with leopardskin upholster He exchanges fives with, Brody (late twenties, bespectacl highly intelligent looking) and his two Henchmen. Brody doesn’t speak. He signs to Henchman #1

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE

dialogues.text: Where’s the -- Brody spins just when a White Gunman leans in through the driver’s door with a 9mm Glock --

One Henchman gets splattered. The other kills the White Man. Tyrone slips and scrambles out of the limo. The White Gun lies dead in the street. Tyrone runs! Frantic, with blood all over him, he runs hyperventilating with panic until two Cops give chase. Sirens and lights. They catch him and slam him against the wall. Cuff wrist one, cuff wrist two.

dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 75 Pop, hit, gulp, snap... Sara’s living room is dominated by a gigantic, towering, black TV. The ominous hulk of technology stares down on Sara who sits in her lazy chair staring at the set’s cold dark screen. Something is wrong. Some coffee: tinkle, perk, drip, slurp, slurp, slurp... Nothing. So one more: Pop, hit, gulp, snap...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 76 77 55. INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 76 Flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh... Crinkle, sprinkle, flick, drift, suck, sigh... Harry and Marion lean against each other on the floor. Th stare up at the ceiling. Sketches and pieces of Marion’s clothing lie around them.

dialogues.text: Oh Harry, I love you. You make me feel like a person, like I’m me and I’m beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You are beautiful. You’re the most beautiful woman in the world. You’re my dream.

dialogues.text: Hello, this is Mrs Goldfarb

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY NURSE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) You’re just becoming adjusted to them. At first you get a strong reaction, but after a while that wears off and you just don’t feel like eating. It’s nothing to worry about, Mrs Goldfarb. Click. Sara stares at the phone and slowly hangs it up. She drops two pills in her hand. She stares at both pills shrugs and pops them: pop, hit, gulp, snap... Then a small grin invades her face. Something’s happening She flips on the TV TO TAPPY:

dialogues.text: Now let’s meet our next winner. She’s a beautiful woman with a winning sense of humor and magical smile. Straight from Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, le give a juicy welcome to Mrs Sara Goldfarb. And there she is! Red, red, red. Sara smiles at Red Sara. The audience loves her.

dialogues.text: Juice by Sara! Juice by Sara! Juice by Sara! o0000000H! Sara’s got juice! Sara’s got juice! 0000000H Sara! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Love...Love, Tyrone C. Seven- three-five. Get your shit together and come on.

dialogues.text: Sheeit.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No one’s got a thing.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Except Big Tim.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: who? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: He’s holdin’ a nice taste.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Some say a piece, others a truckload.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shit. Let’s go see him.

dialogues.text: He’s holdin’, but he’s not sellin’. He’s only givin’ up for pussy.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: The only habit that muthafuck have is pussy. He hooked on that thang. Ah told’im ah give’im all he want, but he say ahm not pretty enough for’im. Just then, a white van screeches to a halt at the corner front of them. The side door slides open. Two white guys toss a dead black guy into a city garbage can. The van screeches off. The black guy’s sneakers poke up o of the can. Harry and Tyrone turn around and quickly exit the scene.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well, why don’t we just stop using? Harry, Tyrone and Marion stare at each other for a moment the implication of Marion’s question slowly, through much resistance, sinking in and registering.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess we’d better.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
