dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 83 We pan the apartment and see Harry, Tyrone and Marion try to do something, anything but nothing. But everything is real slow and every moment is real painful. The kitchen clock is almost moving backwards. We see thei eyes. Their sweating lips. Their twitching fingers.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S MAILBOX 84 NOPE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 85 Pop, hit, gulp, snap -- and again -- pop, hit, gulp, snap Sara stops pacing. Out of breath, she towers over the pho She dials 411. Her mouth races after her speed-drenched mind.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Welcome to Bell Atlantic. Number please?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Malin & Block. Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Please hold for your number. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the fridge shudders. Sara jumps.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: 86 INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 86 Finally Marion stands up:

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: It’s three already. We’re making a big deal out of nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (a bit too willing) Yeah, we can stop using. We proved it. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Harry, it’s stupid to panic and think the world’s coming to an end just "cause we can’t score any solid weight.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: OK, fine. Flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh...

dialogues.speaker: AND
dialogues.text: Crinkle, sprinkle, flick, drift, suck, Sigh...

dialogues.speaker: AND THEN AGAIN
dialogues.text: Flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 87 INT. MARION’S APARTMENT - MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT 87 Harry and Marion twist and turn in their bed. The sheets are covered in sweat. Finally, Marion bolts up in bed gasping for breath. Harry turns on the light.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (nods) Must have had a bad dream, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S KITCHEN. Harry fills a glass of water. He notices that the spot wh he normally shoots up in his inner arm is sore and red.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 88 Marion is still panting when Harry returns with a glass o water.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Maybe we should dip in now.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s all we have.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Tyrone will score in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s a bitch out there.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: It’1l be fine, sweetheart, I just know it will. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess. I’1l1 get the stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I love you, Harry. Relief. For now. Crinkle, sprinkle, flick, drift, suck, sigh...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 89 Pop, hit, gulp, snap. Sara downs a cup of coffee and goes to the phone. Out of the corner of her eye she watches the fridge. She dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Welcome to Malin & Block. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED OPERATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you know your party’s extension, please enter it now. For the directory please press four, one, one. Sara presses 411.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Please enter the last name of the person you are trying to reach.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Russel. Lyle Russel. Sara starts to press some numbers.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (off-screen) We’re sorry, there’s no one in the directory with that name. Please wait for an operator. A moment later an operator answers.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Malin & Block.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Lyle Russel.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) I’m sorry, but I don’t have his name listed on my directory.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: The television.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) What television?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I want to find out.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Hold on a second. Then, a loud shudder! The fridge is vibrating. Sara doesn know what to do. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I want to speak to Lyle Russel.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Who’s that?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: He called me and said I was going to be on a show and --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Just a minute. I’11 connect you with the programs department. Sara waits as the phone rings and rings and the fridge continues to vibrate unnaturally.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I want Lyle Russel.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Lyle Russel? Are you sure you have the right number?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: He’s putting me on a show.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) A show? What show? Still on the phone, Sara slowly walks over to the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) I’m afraid I don’t understand. If you can’t tell me --

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: He called me and said I’m going to be on TV and he sent me papers. I sent them back a long time already and I still don’t know when -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THIRD WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Oh, I understand. Just a moment. Some more clicks. Sara can barely stand. As she gets to the fridge, it slowly stops vibrating. Sweat is building.

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Can I help you? Carefully, Sara examines the fridge. She’s having a hard time talking.

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Lyle Russel.

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) who?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Lyle Russel?

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Are you sure you have the right department? And then, suddenly, the entire fridge quakes violently! Sara drops the phone and runs to her bedroom. On the phon

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH WOMAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT - LATE MORNING 90 Marion expectantly watches Harry on the phone. Harry hang up.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tyrone hasn’t found anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well, you have to do something. It’s your fault we don’t have something for the morning.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You were all hot in the biscuit to get off last night.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s all bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to and we could have had something now.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Whatta am I gonna do? Just sit and watch you push off and not go myself?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Then, just don’t put all the weight on me, that’s all. And leave me alone. Pissed beat.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go meet Ty.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’1l fill it up again, man. Things’11 get better soon, then we’1l be puttin’ the bread back in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Tyrone wait by a payphone on an abandoned stree corner.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I gotta call my mom. I just don’t know what to do with her.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Ahm glad ah doan’t have no one laying that kind of heavy motha shit on me, Jim. You honkies are too much with that guilt shit.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Krist, you ain’t kiddin’, man. I sometimes think we’d be better without moms.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Ah doan’ know, man. Mah mom died when ah was eight, but I remember she was one groovy woman. She have seven kids, Jim, an she was all big like an’ all the time singin’ and smilin’. She have a big chest like this and she used to cuddle me, Jim, an’ ah remember how good it felt in there an’ how sweet she smell. You know, she sing an’ it make you feel good all ovuh, jus’ like dope. Small laugh in the freezing cold. Then, a Snot-faced Deal rounds the corner and nods to Tyrone. INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 93 The phone rings! Sara sticks her head out of the bedroom. She looks at the fridge. It’s quiet and still. She sneaks to the lazy chair and flips on the TV. Then she answers the phone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Hey, Ma. How ya doing?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: (scared) Oh, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (off-screen) I wanted to say hello, and that I’11 visit soon. Suddenly, the fridge hops, making a smashing noise. sinks into her chair. Sara lets out a small scream.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Ma? You --

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Can you come now? For a little while?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Ma, I’m tied up. I got a lot of irons in the fire and I have ta be around to take care of’em. The fridge hops again.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: (at fridge) Stop it! (to Harry) Not even a little visit? Please, Harry. Come over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Hey, Ma, will you lighten up and stop playin’ those guilt games with my head? The fridge shakes and quivers like it’s laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Please, Harry...
93 Sara

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 94 Harry takes a deep breath into the phone. Tyrone rounds t corner, smiling. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Look, Ma, I don’t want to hassle you, okay? I loveya and I’1l see you soon. Take care.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Harry, it’s all confusing and -- Harry hangs up and the two of them rush off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: So you want to hear the news?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What news?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: The good news and the bad news.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: The good news is that in a couple of days they’1l be prime on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (psyched) Really! (suspicious) Who told you?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Angel says Sal the Geep has sent word to let go a couple a keys for the Christmas season, he being a good Christian an’ not wantin’ anybody to be wantin’ during this glorious season.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You believe it?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: I didn’t until I heard the bad news. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: The price is doubled and you have to cop for weight, at least half a piece.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ insane!

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: What you gonna do? The man ain’t goin’ to lay no nickel bag on you, thas foe damn sure.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where we gonna get two?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 96 INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 96 Marion can’t believe what Harry just suggested.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You mean Arnold?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well your parents won’t even take your call.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I haven’t seen him in months.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So what? He’s still callin’, ain’t he?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Yes, but I don’t know. Marion stares into Harry’s eyes -- pleading.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t know what else to do. This is our last chance to get back on track. We won’t ha ta scuffle and make that freezing scene every day. We nee the bread. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Getting the bread is not the problem, Harry --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then what’s the problem, fa krist’s sake?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I just don’t know what I’1l have to do to get it. Harry gets it. Marion gets it. But for Harry, this is too important. He gets down and holds her hand:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look baby, this is our last chance to get back on track. We’1l be back in bizness in no time. We’1l start moving again and we’1ll start saving again. It’1ll happen, Marion. Marion looks into him. Then, she gives him a gentle nod.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PILL
dialogues.text: What seems to be the problem? The weight is doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: The weight is fine. I’m not so good. The refrigerator -- Suddenly, she looks around terrified.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PILL
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Things are all mixed up. Confused like --

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PILL
dialogues.text: Well, that’s nothing to worry about. He scribbles out a prescription.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PILL
dialogues.text: Just give this to the nurse and make an appointment for a week. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now, Sara is alone staring at the paper. TIGHT ON paper. It reads ‘VALIUM’.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RAOUL’S CAFE - NIGHT 98 Dimly lit café. Marion wears lots of make-up and a long- sleeve blouse. Arnold is worried.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No, no, I’ve just had the flu forever it seems like.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: Are you depressed?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No, it’s nothing like that. Just been very busy. I’ve been designing nonstop.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: That’s wonderful, I’m glad to hear you’ve been productive. He smiles and touches her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: To be perfectly straight, I was surprised to hear from you. Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No, why?

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: That’s usually the case when someone calls whom you haven’t heard from for a while.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No, everything’s fine, but I do have a favor to ask. He smiles and leans back into his chair. His smugness bot her so she grabs her fork and stabs it into the back of h hand. Blood spurts out and she screams:

dialogues.speaker: YOU SMUG SONOFABITCH
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A moment later, everything is back to normal. Marion was fantasizing.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: grin) A favor? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I need to borrow some money.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ARNOLD THE SHRINK’S MANHATTAN CRASH PAD 99 In the bedroom, Marion slowly takes off her clothes. She’ dying and almost crying. Arnold, big smile, big erection (for him), watches her.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: May I ask why?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Could you turn off the light?

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: Why do you want the light off?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I just do.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD THE SHRINK
dialogues.text: You never did before.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Please, Arnold. Shrugging, he remote controls off the light. Arnold creep up behind her and starts planting kisses on her. Very gently, she begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 100 Harry scratches some vinyl. He takes the LP and frisbees into the wall. It shatters! Then, he collapses onto Marion’s couch, picks up the remo and flips on the set. He tries to watch but he keeps look at the clock. Then, he hears the sounds of sex. He looks up on the TV a sees Marion fucking some dude with a hairy back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: So, Harry lies on the ground and reaches for something un the couch. Then: flick, sizzle, snap, suck, rush, sigh... The image on the set slowly starts to dissolve back to th normal TV show. Harry, a bit more comfortable, reclines on the couch and nods.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ARNOLD THE SHRINK’S MANHATTAN CRASH PAD - HALLWAY 10 At the front door Arnold, wrapped in a sheet, hands Mario some money. She leaves and he quickly locks the door. Down the hallway and into --

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR 102
dialogues.text: -- as anger, disgust and who knows what else billow up inside her. Her eyes begin to tear. Then --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET 103
dialogues.text: -- she leans against the building and vomits.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 104 Marion crawls out of her winter clothes and joins Harry o the couch. They sit on either side of the couch not looking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TYRONE’S NEW PAD 105 Tyrone, in his bikini underwear, stares at a picture of h mom. Alice is gone. He looks at the window. It’s night-time and it’s sleeping

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tyrone starts to get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 106 Pop, gulp, hit, snap... Sara puts on some make-up. Her hand is not steady and her work is far from perfect. The lipstick is lopsided. The mascara is caked on one set of eyelashes. In the red dress, with very little energy, she spins in f of the mirror. She starts a dumpy version of a waltz. Very slowly. Her eyes are sunken and dark-ringed. Flesh hangs from her upp arms and neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Tyrone stroll the aisles with an empty shopping cart. They eye other customers, most of whom are junkies trying to act nonchalant and making believe they’re shopp In actuality they’re just trying to figure out what the f going on.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: You dig the action, man.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I feel like I’m dreamin’.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: I watch your back, you watch mine.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. All they said was be at Waldbaum’s. Just then, they round a corner and spot a Pony-tailed Jun walking into the back loading area. They follow.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 108 109 110 1414 75. INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 108 Marion impatiently circles the apartment. She’s very anxi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Tyrone join a mass of smoking junkies in the ba of the supermarket. Everyone is crowded in by the towerin boxes of produce and canned goods.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Everyone and their mother. A moment later, the steel roll-gate starts to open. All t junkies turn to look. Then, an eighteen-wheeler starts backing into the loading dock. ‘’IRVING’S FLORIDA ORANGES’ is painted onto the tru When the truck stops at the dock, two White Heavies emerg from the front cab. They wear ski masks and carry glisten machine guns. Sitting behind a table in front of the crates of oranges a distinguished Bald Man sporting a white fur coat. He is flanked by two other heavies with masks and machine guns. The junkies applaud! The two men unlock the back of the truck. The Bald Man pops open two steel suitcases on the table. Harry, Tyrone and all the junkies push forward. The men with guns try to control them.

dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 110 Marion, still circling, starts searching the apartment. S rips open her bureau, flips through clothes and unknowing tosses her clothing sketches. They slowly drift to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Tyrone push their way to the front. A few lucky junkies hand the Bald Man money and get their dope. The heavies scream at the junkies to calm down or they’re out here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Then suddenly, Harry spots a Gap-toothed Junkies pulling gun. The men with the machine guns see him and pull out their guns. Harry grabs Tyrone and starts to pull him awa when suddenly: Bang! Gap-tooth’s gun goes off. It hits some oranges behind the Bald Man. The heavies let loose. Bullets everywhere! Harry and Tyrone head for the supermarket in front. Boxes are blowing up around them. The Bald Man slams the steel suitcases closed and starts pulling the truck doors closed. Harry and Tyrone charge into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- with a bunch of other junkies. They rush down an aisle when the Pony-tailed Junkie gets nailed in front of them. He slides across the linoleum leaving a trail of blood be him. Harry and Tyrone leap over the dead body and rush --

dialogues.text: -- just in time to spot the eighteen-wheeler whiz by. Som of the junkies give chase. Harry thinks about it but Ty stops him. Instead, they quickly duck out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TYRONE’S OLD DIVE PAD 114 Tyrone puffs on a cigarette while Harry paces.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Stupid fucking junkie. Fucked. Wwe are fucked. That’s the last shit for miles.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Muthafuckas going back to Florida, sitting on their asses in sun while we’re up here ass-deep in snow.

dialogues.text: Damn it. What are we gonna do now? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then an idea) Hey. What would happen if we went down there to cop?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Now you’re talking -- sunny F.L.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everybody’s up here scufflin’ to stay alive and gettin’ ripped off or knocked off, and nobody’s thought about goin’ right to the fuckin’ source.

dialogues.text: You’re serious?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: What the fuck you talkin’ about? Goin’ up to the muthafuckin’ room clerk at some hotel an’ askin’ for a connection?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: C’mon, Ty, get with it, eh? You tellin’ me you can’t nose our some dope when it’s around?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: You are serious. Tha’s here, man. The Apple’s mah neighborhood. What the fuck ah know about Miami? Them muthafuckin’ Italians ain’t sittin’ aroun’ jus’ waitin’ for me to show up, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dope smells the same there as it does here.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it’s a long-ass walk, man.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not if you’re drivin’. Look man, it’s colder than hell and those streets are hotter’n a bitch. After tonight...shit. Guys are gettin’ knocked off like they’re givin’ away season tickets for every dead fiend. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 115 INT. SARA’ 78.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: That’s no lie, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Man, we got nothin’ to lose, and we got to do it now while we still have a few bucks.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: If it’s such a good idea why ain’t somebody else thought of it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Because they’re assholes. And that’s just it. Nobody else has thought of it. It’s wide open and it we get there before anyone else we can name our own price amd sit back an’ be cool and have those fools scufflin’ the streets for us.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Las’ summer was a ball, Jim...Seems like a thousan’ years since las’ summer. Sheeit.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’1l be back like that, but only better. This is the kinda set up you dream about.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (starts to give in) You know, Angel can probably get us a short if we promise him some dynamite scag.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (gives in) That muthafucka can dig up anything, even the daid.

dialogues.speaker: S APARTMENT 115
dialogues.text: Sara peeks her head into the living room, all the shades curtains are drawn. She quietly tiptoes to the window and peeks out Then she t through the side of the shade. iptoes over to the front door. Very carefully, she removes the tape over the peephole. The hallway is em (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She retapes the peephole. Suddenly, the fridge lurches at her. It slides a good foo towards her. She jumps and runs to her viewing chair.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S APARTMENT Marion rips through the apartment as she searches for something, anything. She sinks to the floor and starts to sob. Just then, Harr walks in on her on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (gets up, screams) Where have you been? I’ve been waiting all night.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where the hell do you think I’ve been?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Where’s the score?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Some dumb-ass junkie --

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Did what? You fucked it up! Don’t tell me you fucked it up!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I didn’t fuck it up. Me and Ty have a plan.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: A plan!? I don’t want another plan, I want my stuff!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What the fuck’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Me!? You promised that everything was gonna be OK. I fucked that sleazebag -- I put myself through hell for you. So what the fuck do you have for me?!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t have anything, nothing, there’s nothing out there.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I don’t give a shit. You loser. You fucking loser, I want you to come through for me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ya think I’m playin’ fuckin’ games, for krist’s sake? You wanna have some extra stuff? Harry calls Tyrone. He grabs the picture of him and Mario in front of the store.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We were hipped to a dude that’s holding some weight, but he ain’t sellin’.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Give me that guy’s number. The guy who likes broads.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Big Tim? What for?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Just give me the number, for krist’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (off-screen) OK, OK. Nine three four...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You worried so goddam much... Harry hangs up on Ty and hands Marion the number on the b of the photo.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Here, go fix yourself up with’im. You won’t have to wait so long, and I won’t have ta freeze my ass off in the fuckin’ streets. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, fuck you! Harry charges out of the apartment. Marion stares after him. We float out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SARA’S APARTMENT 117 Pop, hit, gulp, snap. The fridge lurches another foot tow her. She grabs the giant remote and flips on the TV. On the se is Tappy Tibbons:

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Now let’s meet our next winner. She’s a beautiful woman with a winning sense of humor and magical smile. She’s really gonna win your heart. Straigh from Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, let’s give a juicy welcome our very own Mrs Sara Goldfarb. Red Sara marches out to applause.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY AND AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Juice by Sara! Juice by Sara! Juice by Sara! o00000000H! Sara’s got juice! Sara’s got juice! OOO000000H Sara!

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you. Oh Mr Tibbons, it’s --

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Tappy, please. The fridge lurches again! She tries to ignore it and watc

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: OK, Tappy. It’s a pleasure to be here.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Well, it’s a pleasure to have you. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that is one gorgeous outfit you have.

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: Oh thank you, Tappy. I just want to say hello to my husband, Seymour and my beautiful successful son, Harold. Hello, Harold. I hope you’re happy. I hope you’re in love. Please come and see me and bring Marion, won’t you? The fridge slides closer. She fights not to look.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Hah hah. I’m sure he’1l be here soon. It’s time to start now, are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: Oh yes. I’m ready, I’m ready.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: After you... Tappy motions towards the camera as the audience begins t applaud. And then, Red Sara disappears. Sara hears something. She looks to her right and sees Red Sara standing in her living room. Sara is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Red Sara doesn’t answer, she just huffs and humphs as she inspects the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Who are you? What do you want? Red Sara continues to ignore her as she looks down her no at the apartment. Then Red Sara waves at Tappy Tibbons.

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: Tappy!

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought you’d never ask. Excuse me, everybody. Tappy disappears from the screen. And now he too is with Red Sara in Sara’s living room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sara sits in her chair, dumbfounded. She starts to get mo and more upset as Tappy and Red Sara laugh at her furnish and chatchkas.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: What do you expect? I’m all alone. Could you do better? It’s an old building. Ten years no painting, maybe more. Red Sara and Tappy walk behind Sara’s chair towards the windows.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I’m old. Alone. You don’t understand. I’m trying. I’m trying. Please, please, I’1l1 explain. Now, Tappy and Red Sara laugh as they point at the TV. Sa looks over. On the TV she sees herself in her viewing cha A giant, fanatic audience surrounds her -- laughing and pointing. Then there’s a giant C-R-A-C-K!!! as Sara’s walls split a Suddenly, she’s on a television set. Two TV cameras slide in on her. A Make-up Artist and Sound Man bum rush her. The man trie to put a mic on her while the woman tries to touch up her face.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: No! No! Please, leave me alone! The studio audience is going bananas laughing at her. Cameras and TV cables stretch across the floor. Then the First Assistant Director by camera one cues her:

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ASSISTANT DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Ready, Mrs Goldfarb, three, two, one... He points at Sara and a bright spotlight falls on her. Suddenly, Tappy and Red Sara lead a cha-cha line around S lazy chair. Various weirdos, freaks and girls in bikinis join in. Sara is terrified. The fridge leaps towards her. Sara cries onto her wrinkle red dress. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She sinks to the floor. She crawls to the TV and begs:

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Oh please... please... let me on the show... please... please... any show... please... The partying gets louder and louder. Red Sara is French kissing Tappy Tibbons in Sara’s lazy chair. The fridge is only a few feet from her.

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: Feed me, Sara. Feed me. Tappy joins in:

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Feed me. Feed me. Now the other freaks in the room and the studio crew:

dialogues.speaker: FREAKS AND CREW
dialogues.text: Feed me. Feed me. Feed me. And now, the audience on the TV is chanting it:

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Feed me. FEED ME. FEED ME. The fridge towers over her. Suddenly, metal is tearing an the fridge has a mouth. Freon sprays out of its opening. The giant metal mouth lurches at Sara threatening to bite her. Sara screams and bolts out of her home leaving the front door to her abandoned apartment wide open.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: ON THE THE SCREEN IN WHITE LETTERS: ‘WINTER’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara manically marches down the street. The world shoots her. A train roars by on the elevated tracks up above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119 INT. PONTIAC VENTURA CROSSING VERRAZANO’S BRIDGE - NI Harry and Tyrone ride in a beat-up 1972 Pontiac Ventura 2 Harry drives. TIGHT ON the car tuner. Tyrone spins the dial. Hip-hop blasts on the radio. Then Tyrone turns on the heat.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Angel.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Ah sure hope this mutha works. Ah could use some heat. Ty sparks a joint.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: How long will it take?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We’1l make it in a day, easy.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: California, here we come.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s Florida.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: I know, Jim. I just feel like breaking out into song. Hands slap five. Harry cringes when Tyrone hits his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara sits on the subway. Her hair sticks to her wet face. She turns to the strangers across from her.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I’m going on television. Today I’1l find out when. It’s New York: of course she’s ignored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 1214 Marion sobs into the phone. She shreds the upholstrey on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Florida!? Florida!? When’s he gonna be back?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (off-screen) I don’t know. A few days.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Days!? What am I supposed, to do? You gotta help me!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (off-screen) It’s dry --

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I can get you money, from my parents.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Money means shit.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Please. Angel! Please!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (off-screen) It’s a drought. I ain’t got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Please! Angel! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Secretary looks up, startled. In front of her is Sara. Sara’s hair and body are wet and she is wobbly. The Secretary stares at Sara, not knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Why aren’t you calling me? I have to know when I’m going to be on television. I’m Sara Goldfarb and you should tell me when I’m going to be on television. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Just sit for a moment. I’11 ring them. Sara wobbles to a chair. She’s confused and disorientated Some office women come out from inside the office and hud around her. Some security guards appear as well. Sara tries to stand but she falls over amd lands back in chair. The women tell her to stay seated.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I need to know when maybe you lost my card, please, Dolly, you’11 look and let --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Get her a cup of soup. Tell Mary to call an ambulance. Just relax, Mrs Goldfarb, everything will --

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: (cries) It’s not the prizes. I’11 give them away to the poor, I just want to be on the show. I’m waiting so long to be on with my Harry and grandson -- The Secretary returns with a mug filled with soup.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Here, Mrs Goldfarb, sip this.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Sometimes it takes awhile to get called for a show, Mrs Goldfarb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone drives. TIGHT ON the tuner. The radio plays alternative rock.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit, the heater is just fine. I guess this ain’t goin’ to be sucha bad trip.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s no big thing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (checks odometer ) We’s a couple a hundred miles closer to Miami, Jim. Let’s stop at the next pit and take a taste.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Betta drop a few dexies too and get some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Right on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd watches Sara babble. Two Paramedics arrive.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: (to his partner) Looks like shock. (to Sara) Can you walk?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I’m walking across the stage and you should see my Harold on television. We’re giving the prizes away. I just want to be on television.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: (to women) Do you know her name?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WOMAN
dialogues.text: We think it’s Sara Goldfarb.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: The announcer is calling my Little Red Riding Hood, call Seymour and tell him to pick me up at the beauty parlor. I’ve got the red dress I wore at Harry’s graduation and the gold shoes.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: (gently) Okay, Mrs Goldfarb, let’s just take it nice and easy. Here we go. And the paramedics help poor Sara to her feet. They head the elevator. Sympathy from the staring office women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 INT. MARION’S APARTMENT 125 126 127 Marion stares at Big Tim’s number. A moment later she pic up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Yeah? Marion hangs up. A long beat. Then she dials again.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Yeah!?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (nervous) Hi... Big Tim lets go a big laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara is strapped to a gurney. She mumbles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Oh, Harry. I’m going to be on television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap, rush, sigh... Tyrone leans against the driver’s door -- high. Harry rolls up his sleeve. Right in the crotch of his arm is a nasty hole from shooting too much. It’s infected and rings of red surround it.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sheeit. How long you got that?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A few days.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: That don’t look too good, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It don’t feel too good either. But a little stuff’1ll take care of that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Don’t shoot in there.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’1l blow it if I don’t. Fuck it. Flick, sizzle, snap, suck, slap -- break from the montage For the first time we see a TIGHT CLOSE-UP of a needle go into the hole, then we end the montage -- rush, sigh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security camera studies Marion as she waits at the fron door. Buzz! Marion pushes the door open and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, on her gurney, is pushed through crowded corridors a hospital. The noise and chaos reach her in surreal muff tones. She’s mumbling to herself -- dreaming of being on televis Then she’s slid into the emergency room. Young, serious Doctor Spencer shines a light into her eye Sara tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SPENCER
dialogues.text: No emergency. Take her to psyche.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BIG TIM’S APARTMENT 130 Big Tim’s door opens wide, revealing an even wider Big Ti Big Tim is big in every way. His body is big, his smile i big, his laugh is big and even his apartment is big.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Come in. He steps aside and Marion enters the huge living room wit grand view of Prospect Park. Big Tim takes her coat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Have a seat. What would you like?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (meek) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Oh, you strictly a dope fien’? Marion is startled by Big Tim’s comment. She recovers.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Oh, maybe I’1l have a little chartreuse.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Yellow or green?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (surprised) Oh, ahhh...yellow. Big Tim joins her with the drinks. He takes out a hash pi and sparks it. Marion is offered the pipe and she takes a few pokes.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Marion. Big Tim’s laugh is loud, deep and happy -- a presence of own.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: What you know, Maid Marion. I’m Little John. Big Tim pulls Marion into his chest. She lets him.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: You know what I like best about patty chicks? Marion smiles as she relaxes into him.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: They give good head. Black broads don’t know nothing about giving head. I don’t know why. Might be it has something to do with some ancient tribal custom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Big laugh from Big Tim. He pulls Marion up to him and kis her. After a beat, she kisses back. Then, he backs off.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Better save some of that energy. She lies down on his stomach. Gently he turns her head ar as he pulls out his penis. She stares at Big Tim’s joint knowing what she’s supposed do but not being able to do it. Her insides tremble and knot.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: I know it’s purty, baby, but I didn’t take it out for air. He nudges her and she grabs it and starts kissing it. Suddenly, she stops. She’s going to be sick. Big Tim laug his big laugh and points to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: That way.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BIG TIM’S BATHROOM 131 Marion finishes barfing. She washes her face and mouth in the sink. She looks up at herself. She’s trembling. She shuts her eyes and we cut to --

dialogues.speaker: BLACK -
dialogues.text: We hear Marion breathe deeply. She collects herself. Into the BLACK rushes streams of RED. When she opens her eyes we are back in -

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM 132
dialogues.text: Marion fixes her hair and smiles at herself.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BIG TIM’S LIVING ROOM 133 Big Tim laughs as Marion emerges from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Sorry. Must have been the chartreuse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Welcome back. Marion’s smile turns into an eager grin. He chuckles as s gets on her knees.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Yeahhhh, little bo-peep done foun’ her sheep. Big Tim laughs his big laugh as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone drives while Harry squirms. His arm hurts like hel TIGHT ON tuner. The radio plays country and western.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: I told you to stay away from that arm, man.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I gotta call Marion. Tyrone watches the odometer changes from 599 to 600.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Well, it’1l be long-distance now. That’s six hundred. We six hundred damn miles closer to Miami.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. We’re also six hundred miles away from New York. Afraid now, Tyrone looks out the window. The landscape is foreign and strange -- almost alien.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 135 INT. BIG TIM’S BATHROOM 135 After sex, Big Tim opens the door and leans up against th doorway. Naked, he watches Marion as she finishes getting dressed. Marion can’t look at herself in the mirror or at Big Tim.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: You know, baby, I can fix it so you can pick up a real, nice taste. Though it’s more like play, baby. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sunday night we’re having a gathering, all good people --

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (smiles) No, I couldn’t. I’m busy. And I’m not really hooked. Big Tim laughs his big laugh and tosses her some bags.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. But I’m tellin’ ya’, it’s a real nice taste. Marion quickly grabs the bags and starts putting them in purse.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: What the fuck you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (startled) Nothing, I’m...

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Damn! (laughs) Damn, I got me some kinda virgin. Now you gotta be kidding ol’ Tim, you just got to be.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I don’t kn --

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: You mean you not going to count what’s there but you just going to be puttin’ it in your pocketbook and just walk out in the street? Damn! You sure haven’t been around long, baby.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (flushed) I’m not exactly a naive school girl, I... I... I’ve been all through Europe an’... an’... and I’m just not --

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Sheeit, ain’t nothing to be ashamed of, baby, we all gotta get down with it for the first time. I ain’t bad rappinya. I just don’t want to see you get ripped off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sheeit, you earned that baby and you sure as hell don’t w to donate it to some purse snatcher. He laughs. Marion smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: Lookit, there be one place you can stash 01’ doogie without you worrying about it be accidently getting in the wrong hands, you dig? Ain’t no purse snatcher or mugger going to rip you off there, baby. As Marion catches on she flushes and nods her head. Big Tim laughs his big laugh as he wanders into the livin room.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM
dialogues.text: I’1l see you Sunday, Maid Marion. Then Marion lifts up her skirt and does the deed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara is strapped to a hospital bed. She sobs to herself. The grey ward is packed with twice as many beds as there should be. Patients wander around in straitjackets. Screa of agony and pain barely reach her ears. Doctor Spencer addresses Sara and tries to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SPENCER
dialogues.text: Mrs Goldfarb. Please try and answer me. When did you start taking the pills?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: When? The summer... Oh, this summer. I got a special place in the sun. Ada fixed my hair.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SPENCER
dialogues.text: You started in the summer. Last summer? OK Mrs Goldfarb, everything will be alright, we’1ll fix you up in no time.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: (grins) You’re a good boy, Harold. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And for a moment, Doctor Spencer is Harry -- golden smile and all.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARION’S BATHROOM 137 We look down on Marion’s back from above the tub. She is bent over, her head beneath the water between her knees. She holds her breath for an eternity... Then, we look into her face as she screams. Air bubbles shoot to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone still drives. There’s a preacher screaming gospel on the radio. Harry squirms as he grabs his arm. He’s wincing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY

Even worse, the area around the white is slightly green. Also, a wide dark red streak reaches down his arm towards his hand. They both stare at it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh man.

dialogues.text: Sheeit, that be the ugliest mothafucka I’ve ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TIM

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (nervous) Hi... Big Tim lets go a big laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (slow motion) S-w-a-l-l-o-w! S-w-a-1-1-o-w! But the food just dribbles out the side. As they continue their conversation about the Jets, they grab her and forc the food down her throat by holding her nose and keeping mouth shut. Her eyes blast open in terror. dialogues.text: Doctor Spencer towers over Sara. He reads her chart and i concerned.

The grab her and move her into a wheelchair. Restraints for h arms and legs are slapped on. They grab a clear plastic tube. They cover it with lubric Then they try to slide it into her nose. dialogues.text: Harry in pain on the telephone. Marion sits by the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Marion.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: MARION

dialogues.text: Mrs Goldfarb, we’ve tried several medications and you don’t seem to be responding. I believe we’ve come to a point where we need to try some alternative methods. We’ve had excellent results with these techniques in the past. So if I can just get your John Hancock, we’1l get underway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Jesus krist. I need a doctor.

dialogues.text: Tyrone tries to keep Harry in line with all the convicts Harry can barely stand. A Court Doctor, followed by two Guards, moves from prison to prisoner. Bored to death he looks into each prisoner’s eyes with a mini-mag and says:

dialogues.text: Sara continues her trip on the gurney. Terror enters her heart.

dialogues.text: Can you hear me? Can you see me?

dialogues.text: Can you hear me? Can you see me?

TIGHT ON Big Tim’s knowin smile. TIGHT ON cigars in strangers’ mouths. TIGHT ON mal hands clapping. TIGHT ON empty faces of five other pretty women checking out Marion.

There’s nipples, tongues, sex toys, eyes closed in ecstas men’s glares, men’s smiles and the like. The images aren’ sexy, they’re scary. dialogues.speaker: PRIMARY BLUE 169

But she doesn’t hear him and she keeps walking. He runs after them. When he gets close, he suddenly stops. Marion turns aroun He reaches to hug her. But, as he does we are in --

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Marion.

dialogues.text: Who’s that? She’1l be sent for. She’11 come. She loves you and she’1l1 come. Then Harry opens his eyes fully. For a moment he understa He is an adult and he is calm.

dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. She won't.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIC NURSE
dialogues.text: She’1l1 come.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. She won't. And then Harry starts to cry. As we float up high above h bed we watch him curl into a ball.

Then, she hugs it tight against her bosom. Slowly, she curls up into a fetal position, conten

Then, Tyrone and his bed dissolve into the past. Young Ty rests in his mom’s generous arms. Finally, it is peaceful. Tyrone’s mom brushes the tears from his eyes. TYRONE’S MOTHER How’s your tummy feel?

dialogues.text: 175 176 177 TYRONE’S MOTHER The sweetness be in you, child, the sweetness be in you.

Sara shuffles towards them and they barely recognize her. Her grey roots match her grey skin which matches her grey gown. Ada starts taking food out of a large shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: We got some lox and cream cheese and bagels and blintzes with sour cream and some danishes and pastrami and chopped liver on rye with mustard and onions and a container of tea and... How are you, Dolly? But Sara doesn’t answer. She can’t. They put their hands on their friend’s shoulders but nothing seems to reach he Then they notice that water is dripping down Sara’s leg a onto the floor. Sara has urinated on herself.

dialogues.text: Sara lies on her bed. A tiny smile emerges on her face. We get closer and closer to her until we go into the blac of her pupil. Deep in the blackness we see another world. It is a world of PRIMARY BLUE. And sucking us into the blue is the roar of a crowd. And there with a giant smile is good ol’ Tappy in black t (CONTINUED)
177 He looks into the camera and says:

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: And our next winner is that delightful personality, straight from Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, please give a juicy welcome to Mrs Goldfarb. Red Sara steps out and joins Tappy. She’s overwhelmed.

dialogues.text: Juice by Sara! Juice by Sara! Juice by Sara! o00000000H! Sara’s got juice! Sara’s got juice! OOO000000H Sara!

dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Yes! How does it feel?!

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: It feels great. I feel wonderful. I feel amazing. This is great! The audience goes crazy, they love it. And they start to chant: The chant

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: We love Sara! We love Sara! continues...

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: They love you, Sara.

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: I love them. Oh, I love them.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY TIBBONS
dialogues.text: Now let me show you what you’ve won. Your prize has a sweet smile and his own private business. He just got engaged and he’s planning to get Married this summer. Will you please give a juicy welcome to Mrs Sara Goldfarb’s one and only son -- Harry Goldfarb! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAPPY AND AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Juice by Harry! Juice by Harry! Juice by Harry! o0000000H! Harry’s got juice! Harry’s got juice! OOO000000H Harry! Harry walks out and hugs his mother.

dialogues.speaker: RED SARA
dialogues.text: Oh Harry, Harry, Harry. I love you, Harry.

dialogues.text: I love you too, Ma. They hug and they hug as the audience scream their applau A smile fills Sara’s beautiful face. Happiness. Total and complete love. Except for the truth, the nagging reality. It means tears for Sara and her sparkling eyes well up with fantastic, w tears. But they don’t damage her glorious smile.
